alert.note: Alert for Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 9:37PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado and western Wallace Counties in west central Kansas through 900 PM MDT... At 837 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Weskan, or 12 miles west of Sharon Springs. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado and western Wallace Counties in west central Kansas, including the following locations... Arapahoe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
